statements: UPDATE financial_data SET revenue = 50000 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE financial_data SET profit = 20000, revenue = 70000 WHERE company_name = 'ABC Company' AND date = '2023-01-15';
UPDATE financial_data SET profit = 5000 WHERE company_name = 'Company A' AND date = '2022-01-01';
UPDATE financial_data SET revenue = 10000, profit = 7500 WHERE id = 2;
UPDATE FinancialData SET revenue = 15000.50, expenses = 9000.25 WHERE id = 1
UPDATE GrowthMetrics SET market_share = 0.25, revenue_growth = 20.75, user_growth = 500 WHERE id = 3
UPDATE FinancialData SET revenue = revenue + 10000, expenses = expenses - 5000 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE GrowthMetrics SET market_share = market_share * 1.05, revenue_growth = revenue_growth + 0.02 WHERE id = 2;
UPDATE financial_data SET revenue = 50000.00, expenses = 30000.00 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE growth_trends SET growth_rate = 0.05 WHERE trend_id = 2;
UPDATE financial_data SET revenue = 15000.00, expenses = 8000.00 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE growth_trends SET growth_rate = 0.05 WHERE trend_id = 3;
UPDATE financial_data SET revenue = 5000 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE revenue_forecast SET forecasted_revenue = 7500, forecast_date = '2022-10-15' WHERE id = 2;
UPDATE financial_data SET revenue = 5000.25, expense = 3000.50 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE growth_trends SET trend_value = 0.75, trend_date = '2022-10-15' WHERE trend_type = 'Positive';
UPDATE historical_financial_data SET expenses = 15000 WHERE date = '2022-01-15';
UPDATE revenue_forecast SET forecasted_revenue = 250000, confidence_level = 0.85 WHERE date = '2022-02-28';
UPDATE historical_financial_data SET revenue = 15000, expenses = 10000, profit = revenue - expenses WHERE date = '2022-01-01';
UPDATE financial_metrics SET metric_value = metric_value * 1.1 WHERE metric_name = 'Gross Profit Margin';
